00046 namespace sc_core {
00047 
00048 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 //  ENUM : sc_severity
00050 //
00051 //  Enumeration of possible exception severity levels
00052 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 
00054 enum sc_severity {
00055     SC_INFO = 0,        // informative only
00056     SC_WARNING, // indicates potentially incorrect condition
00057     SC_ERROR,   // indicates a definite problem
00058     SC_FATAL,   // indicates a problem from which we cannot recover
00059     SC_MAX_SEVERITY
00060 };
00061 
00062 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00063 //  ENUM : sc_verbosity
00064 //
00065 //  Enumeration of message verbosity.
00066 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00067 
00068  enum sc_verbosity {
00069      SC_NONE = 0,
00070      SC_LOW = 100,
00071      SC_MEDIUM = 200,
00072      SC_HIGH = 300,
00073      SC_FULL = 400,
00074      SC_DEBUG = 500
00075  };
00076 
00077 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 //  ENUM :
00079 //
00080 //  Enumeration of actions on an exception (implementation specific)
00081 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 
00083 typedef unsigned sc_actions;
00084 
00085 enum {
00086     SC_UNSPECIFIED  = 0x0000, // look for lower-priority rule
00087     SC_DO_NOTHING   = 0x0001, // take no action (ignore if other bits set)
00088     SC_THROW        = 0x0002, // throw an exception
00089     SC_LOG          = 0x0004, // add report to report log
00090     SC_DISPLAY      = 0x0008, // display report to screen
00091     SC_CACHE_REPORT = 0x0010, // save report to cache
00092     SC_INTERRUPT    = 0x0020, // call sc_interrupt_here(...)
00093     SC_STOP         = 0x0040, // call sc_stop()
00094     SC_ABORT        = 0x0080, // call abort()
00095 
00096     // default action constants
00097     SC_DEFAULT_INFO_ACTIONS    = SC_LOG | SC_DISPLAY,
00098     SC_DEFAULT_WARNING_ACTIONS = SC_LOG | SC_DISPLAY,
00099     SC_DEFAULT_ERROR_ACTIONS   = SC_LOG | SC_CACHE_REPORT | SC_THROW,
00100     SC_DEFAULT_FATAL_ACTIONS   = SC_LOG | SC_DISPLAY | SC_CACHE_REPORT | SC_ABORT,
00101     SC_DEFAULT_CATCH_ACTIONS   = SC_DISPLAY
00102 };
00103 
00104 class sc_object;
00105 class sc_time;
00106 struct sc_msg_def;
00107 class sc_report;
00108 class sc_report_handler;
00109 SC_API const std::string sc_report_compose_message( const sc_report& );

00111 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00112 //  CLASS : sc_report
00113 //
00114 //  Exception reporting
00115 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00116 
00117 class SC_API sc_report : public std::exception
00118 {
00119     friend class sc_report_handler;
00120     friend SC_API sc_report* sc_handle_exception();
00121 
00122     sc_report(); // used internally by sc_handle_exception
00123 
00124 public:
00125 
00126     sc_report(const sc_report&);
00127 
00128     sc_report & operator=(const sc_report&);
00129 
00130     virtual ~sc_report() SC_NOEXCEPT_;
00131 
00132     const char * get_msg_type() const;
00133 
00134     const char * get_msg() const
00135         { return msg; }
00136 
00137     sc_severity get_severity() const
00138         { return severity; }
00139 
00140     const char * get_file_name() const
00141         { return file; }
00142 
00143     int get_line_number() const
00144         { return line; }
00145 
00146     const sc_time & get_time() const
00147         { return *timestamp; }
00148 
00149     const char* get_process_name() const;
00150 
00151     int get_verbosity() const { return m_verbosity_level; }
00152 
00153     bool valid () const;
00154 
00155     virtual const char* what() const SC_NOEXCEPT_
00156         {
00157             return m_what;
00158         }
00159 
00160     void swap( sc_report& );
00161 
00162 protected:
00163 
00164     sc_report(sc_severity,
00165               const sc_msg_def*,
00166               const char* msg,
00167               const char* file,
00168               int line,
00169               int verbosity_level=SC_MEDIUM);
00170 
00171     sc_severity        severity;
00172     const sc_msg_def*  md;
00173     char*              msg;
00174     char*              file;
00175     int                line;
00176     sc_time*           timestamp;
00177     char*              process_name;
00178     int                m_verbosity_level;
00179     char*              m_what;
00180 
00181 public:  // backward compatibility with 2.0+
00182 
00183     static const char* get_message(int id);
00184     static bool is_suppressed(int id);
00185     static void make_warnings_errors(bool);
00186     static void register_id(int id, const char* msg);
00187     static void suppress_id(int id, bool); // only for info or warning
00188     static void suppress_infos(bool);
00189     static void suppress_warnings(bool);
00190 
00191     int get_id() const;
00192 };
00193 
00194 typedef std::exception sc_exception;
00195 
00196 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00197 //  Report macros.
00198 //
00199 //  Use these macros to report an info, warning, error, or fatal.
00200 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00201 
00202 #define SC_REPORT_INFO( msg_type, msg )    \
00203     ::sc_core::sc_report_handler::report(  \
00204             ::sc_core::SC_INFO, msg_type, msg, __FILE__, __LINE__ )
00205 
00206 #define SC_REPORT_INFO_VERB( msg_type, msg, verbosity )   \
00207     ::sc_core::sc_report_handler::report(                 \
00208             ::sc_core::SC_INFO, msg_type, msg, verbosity, \
00209                                __FILE__ , __LINE__ )
00210 
00211 #define SC_REPORT_WARNING( msg_type, msg ) \
00212     ::sc_core::sc_report_handler::report(  \
00213             ::sc_core::SC_WARNING, msg_type, msg, __FILE__, __LINE__ )
00214 
00215 #define SC_REPORT_ERROR( msg_type, msg )  \
00216     ::sc_core::sc_report_handler::report( \
00217             ::sc_core::SC_ERROR, msg_type, msg, __FILE__, __LINE__ )
00218 
00219 #define SC_REPORT_FATAL( msg_type, msg )  \
00220     ::sc_core::sc_report_handler::report( \
00221             ::sc_core::SC_FATAL, msg_type, msg, __FILE__, __LINE__ )
00222 
00223 
00224 // SC_NORETURN_ macro, indicating that a function does not return
00225 #if SC_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L && (!defined(_MSC_VER) || _MSC_VER >= 1900)
00226 // C++11: use standard C++ attribute
00227 # define SC_NORETURN_ [[noreturn]]
00228 #else
00229 # if defined(_MSC_VER)
00230 #    define SC_NORETURN_ __declspec(noreturn)
00231 # elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__clang__)
00232 #    define SC_NORETURN_ __attribute__((noreturn))
00233 # else
00234 #    define SC_NORETURN_ /* nothing */
00235 # endif
00236 #endif // SC_NORETURN_
00237 
00238 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00239 //  FUNCTION : sc_abort()
00240 //
00241 //  Like abort(), never returns and aborts the current program immediately,
00242 //  but may print additional information.
00243 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00244 
00245 SC_NORETURN_ SC_API void sc_abort();
00246 
00247 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00248 //  MACRO : sc_assert(expr)
00249 //
00250 //  Like assert(), but additionally prints the current process name
00251 //  and simulation time, if the simulation is running.
00252 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00253 
00254 #if defined(NDEBUG) && !defined(SC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS) // disable assertions
00255 
00256 #define sc_assert(expr) \
00257  ((void) 0)
00258 
00259 #else // enable assertions
00260 
00261 #define sc_assert(expr) \
00262  ((void)((expr) ? 0 : \
00263    (::sc_core::sc_assertion_failed(#expr,__FILE__,__LINE__),0)))
00264 
00265 #endif // defined(NDEBUG) && !defined(SC_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS)
00266 
00267 SC_NORETURN_ SC_API  void
00268 sc_assertion_failed(const char* msg, const char* file, int line);
00269 
00270 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_UNKNOWN_ERROR_[];
00271 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_WITHOUT_MESSAGE_[];
00272 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_[];
00273 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_INTERNAL_ERROR_[];
00274 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_ASSERTION_FAILED_[];
00275 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_[];
00276 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_ABORT_[];
00277 
00278 // backward compatibility with 2.0+
00279 extern SC_API const char SC_ID_REGISTER_ID_FAILED_[];
00280 
00281 } // namespace sc_core
